ask.question: When applying patching compound, it is a good idea to cut a notch in one side of the broad knife blade, _______________, to be used to screed around finished edges.

answer.B: To the thickness of the flooring

answer.C: Twice the thickness of the flooring

answer.D: Half the thickness of the flooring

answer.correct: B - To the thickness of the flooring

ask.question: The two categories of patching and leveling products are:

answer.A: Portland and skim coat based compounds.

answer.B: Gypsum and skim coat based compounds.

answer.correct: C - Portland and Gypsum based compounds.

ask.question: When preparing the substrate, lightweight concrete or non-porous surfaces such as ceramic tile, metal, vinyl, etc. may require priming. Apply the primer using ___________.
When mixing the patching and leveling compounds:

answer.A: Place the powder into the mixing container, slowly add water, then begin mixing.

answer.B: Place the liquid into the mixing container, then add all of the powder, then begin mixing.

answer.C: Place the powder into the mixing container, then add all of the liquid while mixing.

answer.D: Place the liquid into the mixing container, then slowly add the powder while mixing.

answer.correct: D - Place the liquid into the mixing container, then slowly add the powder while mixing.

ask.question: When mixing the patching compound, it is important to remember:

answer.A: Not to mix the patch directly on the substrate.

answer.B: Not to use portland based products over gypsum based products.

answer.C: Not to add additional liquid the mixed patch begins to dry.

ask.question: When applying patching compound, use a steel trowel at a slight angle that is:

answer.C: Exactly half the angle as when spreading adhesive.

answer.D: Exactly twice the angle as when spreading adhesive.

answer.correct: A - Less than when spreading adhesive.

ask.question: When building a ramp from one level to another during the patching and leveling process, the _________ will determine the _________ of the ramp.
